Phenomenal space is adaptive

Last updated on May 20, 2021

If the phenomenal space is the state space of all possible experiences, then one can note that it’s adapted to the needs of the organism. It’s easy to imagine eating than solving differential equations. Ease of imagining, or conceivability, might be a probe for [[ Phenomenal (re)presentations have bottom-up and top-down influences|phenomenal space ]]. Probing this space might help locate attractors and repellors. However, the phenomenal space might be disentangled into subspaces, say for conscious thought, attention, volition.

Resources

  • https://mitpress.mit.edu/books/being-no-one
